lead_paragraph: Officials and elders in Paktika Province said 17 civilians were killed in American drone strikes, while a United States military spokesman said there was no evidence of such casualties.

byline.contributor: Farooq Jan Mangal reported from Khost, Afghanistan, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul.
byline.original: By FAROOQ JAN MANGAL and MUJIB MASHAL

headline.print_headline: Civilians Killed in U.S. Airstrikes, Afghan Officials Say; Americans Deny Account
headline.main: At Least 17 Civilians Killed in U.S. Airstrikes, Afghan Officials Say

snippet: Officials and elders in Paktika Province said 17 civilians were killed in American drone strikes, while a United States military spokesman said there was no evidence of such casualties.
abstract: Afghan officials say United States drones killed 17 people in strikes in southeast Afghanistan, contradicting American and other authorities' claims that operation killed only militants.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
